SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL
Class HLAPI

java.lang.Object
  com.uce.userlab.haptics.HL.HLAPI

public class HLAPI
extends java.lang.Object

This Class is the Java Implementation of OpenHaptics API HLAPI, this class is includes all the methods needed to bind to OpenGL (JOGL). Many of the methods and functions have been updated and changed, and in some cases removed to make this more robust and stable. It must be stressed that this is the first generation of this implementation.

Field Summary
static int HL_ADAPTIVE_VIEWPORT
          Allows the optimization of single pass rendering for depth buffer, this is incompatible it HL_HAPTIC_CAMERA_VIEW.
static int HL_BACK
          Applys material properties only to the back of the shape
static int HL_BUTTON1_STATE
          Gets the Button1 state, value of true means the button is depressed
static int HL_BUTTON2_STATE
          Gets the Button2 state, value of true means the button is depressed
static int HL_CLIENT_THREAD
          This will indicate that the Callback method will be called from client thread or when the client calls hlCheckEvents
static int HL_COLLISION_THREAD
          This will indicate that the Callback method will be called from the internal collision thread
static int HL_CONSTRAINT
          Set a surface (geometric primitives) not to allow the proxy off the surface, it will only be allowed to move off the surface if device position from surface is greater than snap distance
static int HL_CONTACT
          Set a surface (geometric primitives) not to allow the proxy to pass though it, it may move off the surface but must stay one side of it
static int HL_DAMPING
          Allows damping to be controlled, this will reduce the springiness of surfaces.
static int HL_DEVICE_FORCE
          Gets Vector of 3 doubles representing the last force, in world co-ordinates, sent to the haptic device
static int HL_DEVICE_POSITION
          Gets a Vector of 3 doubles representing the position of the haptics device in world co-ordinates
static int HL_DEVICE_ROTATION
          Gets a Vector of 4 doubles representing a quaternion that specifies the rotation of the haptic device in world co-ordinates
static int HL_DEVICE_TORQUE
          Gets Vector of 3 doubles representing the last torque, in world co-ordinates, sent to the haptic device
static int HL_DEVICE_TRANSFORM
          Gets Vector 16 doubles representing a 4x4 transform matrix in column major order that specifies the transform of the haptic device relative to world co-ordinates
static int HL_DYNAMIC_FRICTION
          Allows dynamic friction to be controlled, this will effect the resistance a surface gives once movement is has started along the surface.
static int HL_EFFECT_CALLBACK
          Allows the user to create a custom effect by setting a effect callback from the renderer
static int HL_EFFECT_COMPUTE_FORCE
          Gets the computed force for the effect
static int HL_EFFECT_CONSTANT
          Adds a constant force vector to the total force sent to the haptic device
static int HL_EFFECT_FRICTION
          Adds a friction force to the total force sent to the hatic device, this friction is for both when touching objects and when in free space
static int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_DIRECTION
          This property is used by constant effect.
static int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_DURATION
          Used by all effects started with a call to hlTriggerEffect.
static int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_FREQUENCY
          Reserved for use by future effect types and callback effects
static int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_GAIN
          This property is used by spring, friction and viscous effect types.
static int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_MAGNITUDE
          This property is used by constant, spring, friction and viscous effect types.
static int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_POSITION
          This property is used by spring effect.
static int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_TYPE
          Gets the effect property type that is current selected
static int HL_EFFECT_SPRING
          Adds a spring force to the total force sent to the haptic device, this force will pull the proxy towards event point
static int HL_EFFECT_START
          Indicates the start of an effect definition or excution
static int HL_EFFECT_STOP
          Indicates the end of a effect excution or definition
static int HL_EFFECT_VISCOUS
          Adds a viscous force to the total force sent to the haptic device, this force will apply resistance according to the velocity of the haptic device
static int HL_EVENT_1BUTTONDOWN
          An event type that is fired when button 1 is depressed
static int HL_EVENT_1BUTTONUP
          An event type that is fired when button 1 is released
static int HL_EVENT_2BUTTONDOWN
          An event type that is fired when button 2 is depressed
static int HL_EVENT_2BUTTONUP
          An event type that is fired when button 2 is released
static int HL_EVENT_CALIBRATION_INPUT
          An event type that is fired when a Calibration update is required and needs user input.
static int HL_EVENT_CALIBRATION_UPDATE
          An event type that is fired when a Calibration update has been made
static int HL_EVENT_MOTION
          An event type that is fired when the proxy has moved or rotated more than the tolerance set
static int HL_EVENT_MOTION_ANGULAR_TOLERANCE
          Gets a double value for the precision of the device, the minimum rotation the device needs to move before a motion event is fired
static int HL_EVENT_MOTION_LINEAR_TOLERANCE
          Gets a double value for the precision of the device, the minimum distance the device needs to move in the workspace before a motion event is fired
static int HL_EVENT_TOUCH
          An event type that is fired when a shape within a scene is touched
static int HL_EVENT_UNTOUCH
          An event type that is fired when a shape within a scene is no longer being touched
static int HL_FRONT
          Applys material properties only to the front of the shape
static int HL_FRONT_AND_BACK
          Applys material properties to the front and back of the shape
static int HL_HAPTIC_CAMERA_VIEW
          Allows the enhanced shape render to be used, this will allow depth features to be felt by the user that are normally occluded by basic rending.
static int HL_LOCAL_FEATURE_LINE
          The Local line is give by a start point (Vector) and a end point (Vector)
static int HL_LOCAL_FEATURE_PLANE
          The Local plan is a whose normal is given by a Vectors and what passes though it
static int HL_LOCAL_FEATURE_POINT
          The Local point is a single point whose position is given by a Vector
static int HL_MAX_WORKSPACE_DIMS
          Gets the Workspace Maximum Dimensions that can be used
static int HL_OBJECT_ANY
          Sets the Event Callback to occure for any object within a scene
static int HL_PROXY_IS_TOUCHING
          Gets a singel boolean value indicating weather the proxy is in contact with a shape
static int HL_PROXY_POSITION
          Gets a Vector of 3 doubles representing the position of proxy in world co-ordinates
static int HL_PROXY_RESOLUTION
          Allows a single boolean value to specify weather the proxy position is update automatically, this will be valid for all shapes in frame
static int HL_PROXY_ROTATION
          Gets a Vector of 4 doubles representing a quaternion that specifies the rotation of the proxy world co-ordinates
static int HL_PROXY_TOUCH_NORMAL
          Gets a Vector of 3 doubles representing the point of contact, only valid if HL_PROXY_IS_TOUCHING is true
static int HL_PROXY_TRANSFORM
          Gets a Vector of 16 doubles representing a 4x4 transform matrix in column major order that specifies the transform of proxy relative to world co-ordinates
static int HL_REACTION_FORCE
          Gets a Vector of 3 doubles representing the shapes overall reaction force sent to the haptic device for the last frame
static int HL_SHAPE_CALLBACK
          Allows the creation of custom shaped that are not supported by other commands, OpenGL commands are ignored for this shape type
static int HL_SHAPE_CLOSEST_FEATURES
          This is used to set a Callback to find closest point on the surface to an input point as well as one or more local features
static int HL_SHAPE_DEPTH_BUFFER
          Allows depth commands for the OpenGL (JOGL) to be read and used with the haptic render
static int HL_SHAPE_DYNAMIC_SURFACE_CHANGE
          Allows you to pass a single boolean value to indicate weather the following shape should be treated as a dynamically changing surface.
static int HL_SHAPE_FEEDBACK_BUFFER
          Allows the use of a Optimally allocated buffer for OpenGL (JOGL) buffer reading
static int HL_SHAPE_FEEDBACK_BUFFER_VERTICES
          Allows you to specify to the render approximately how many vertices will be in the next feedback so it can reserve the correct amount of memory
static int HL_SHAPE_INTERSECT_LS
          This is used to set a Callback to a intersect line of a user defined custom shape
static int HL_SNAP_DISTANCE
          Allows the Snap Distance for the HL_CONSTRAINT to be set, the value must be a float value representing the distance in millimeters
static int HL_STATIC_FRICTION
          Allows static friction to be controlled, this will effect the resistance a surface gives to move along the surface.
static int HL_STIFFNESS
          Allows stiffness to be controlled, this will effect how hard a surface will feel.
static int HL_TOUCH_MODEL
          Gets the type of Touch Model that is being used, e.g: HL_CONTACT
static int HL_TOUCHABLE_FACE
          Allows the touchable surface to be specified
static int HL_TOUCHWORKSPACE
          All matrix manipulation commands will target the transform from touch co-ordinates to the local co-ordinates of the haptic device
static int HL_TOUCHWORKSPACE_MATRIX
          Gets array of 16 doubles representing 4x4 transform matrix in column major order for co-ordinates from touch to workspace
static int HL_VENDOR
          Gets the name of the company responsible for the renderer library that this API is binding to
static int HL_VERSION
          Gets the version of the haptic library that this API is binding to
static int HL_VIEWTOUCH
          All matrix manipulation commands will target the transform from view co-ordinates to touch co-ordinates
static int HL_VIEWTOUCH_MATRIX
          Gets array of 16 doubles representing 4x4 transform matrix in column major order for co-ordinates from view to touch
static int HL_WORKSPACE
          Gets the details of the Workspace that is being used

Field Detail

HL_STIFFNESS

public static final int HL_STIFFNESS
Allows stiffness to be controlled, this will effect how hard a surface will feel. Value must be between 0 and 1, where 1 is the hardest and 0 the softest

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_DAMPING

public static final int HL_DAMPING
Allows damping to be controlled, this will reduce the springiness of surfaces. Value must be between 0 and 1, where 1 is the least springiness and 0 the highly springy

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_STATIC_FRICTION

public static final int HL_STATIC_FRICTION
Allows static friction to be controlled, this will effect the resistance a surface gives to move along the surface. Value must be between 0 and 1, where 1 is the maximum friction for a surface and 0 is a completely frictionless surface

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_DYNAMIC_FRICTION

public static final int HL_DYNAMIC_FRICTION
Allows dynamic friction to be controlled, this will effect the resistance a surface gives once movement is has started along the surface. Value must be between 0 and 1, where 1 is the maximum friction for a suface and 0 is a completely frictionless surface

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_HAPTIC_CAMERA_VIEW

public static final int HL_HAPTIC_CAMERA_VIEW
Allows the enhanced shape render to be used, this will allow depth features to be felt by the user that are normally occluded by basic rending. It is Disabled by default

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EVENT_2BUTTONDOWN

public static final int HL_EVENT_2BUTTONDOWN
An event type that is fired when button 2 is depressed

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EVENT_2BUTTONUP

public static final int HL_EVENT_2BUTTONUP
An event type that is fired when button 2 is released

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EVENT_TOUCH

public static final int HL_EVENT_TOUCH
An event type that is fired when a shape within a scene is touched

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EVENT_UNTOUCH

public static final int HL_EVENT_UNTOUCH
An event type that is fired when a shape within a scene is no longer being touched

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EVENT_CALIBRATION_UPDATE

public static final int HL_EVENT_CALIBRATION_UPDATE
An event type that is fired when a Calibration update has been made

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EVENT_CALIBRATION_INPUT

public static final int HL_EVENT_CALIBRATION_INPUT
An event type that is fired when a Calibration update is required and needs user input. e.g: return to dock position

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EVENT_MOTION_LINEAR_TOLERANCE

public static final int HL_EVENT_MOTION_LINEAR_TOLERANCE
Gets a double value for the precision of the device, the minimum distance the device needs to move in the workspace before a motion event is fired

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EVENT_MOTION_ANGULAR_TOLERANCE

public static final int HL_EVENT_MOTION_ANGULAR_TOLERANCE
Gets a double value for the precision of the device, the minimum rotation the device needs to move before a motion event is fired

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_OBJECT_ANY

public static final int HL_OBJECT_ANY
Sets the Event Callback to occure for any object within a scene

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_SHAPE_INTERSECT_LS

public static final int HL_SHAPE_INTERSECT_LS
This is used to set a Callback to a intersect line of a user defined custom shape

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_SHAPE_CLOSEST_FEATURES

public static final int HL_SHAPE_CLOSEST_FEATURES
This is used to set a Callback to find closest point on the surface to an input point as well as one or more local features

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_LOCAL_FEATURE_POINT

public static final int HL_LOCAL_FEATURE_POINT
The Local point is a single point whose position is given by a Vector

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_LOCAL_FEATURE_LINE

public static final int HL_LOCAL_FEATURE_LINE
The Local line is give by a start point (Vector) and a end point (Vector)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_LOCAL_FEATURE_PLANE

public static final int HL_LOCAL_FEATURE_PLANE
The Local plan is a whose normal is given by a Vectors and what passes though it

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_CLIENT_THREAD

public static final int HL_CLIENT_THREAD
This will indicate that the Callback method will be called from client thread or when the client calls hlCheckEvents

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_COLLISION_THREAD

public static final int HL_COLLISION_THREAD
This will indicate that the Callback method will be called from the internal collision thread

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_CALLBACK

public static final int HL_EFFECT_CALLBACK
Allows the user to create a custom effect by setting a effect callback from the renderer

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_CONSTANT

public static final int HL_EFFECT_CONSTANT
Adds a constant force vector to the total force sent to the haptic device

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_SPRING

public static final int HL_EFFECT_SPRING
Adds a spring force to the total force sent to the haptic device, this force will pull the proxy towards event point

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_VISCOUS

public static final int HL_EFFECT_VISCOUS
Adds a viscous force to the total force sent to the haptic device, this force will apply resistance according to the velocity of the haptic device

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_FRICTION

public static final int HL_EFFECT_FRICTION
Adds a friction force to the total force sent to the hatic device, this friction is for both when touching objects and when in free space

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_TYPE

public static final int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_TYPE
Gets the effect property type that is current selected

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_GAIN

public static final int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_GAIN
This property is used by spring, friction and viscous effect types. The higher the gains will mean the greater the force that will be generated

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_MAGNITUDE

public static final int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_MAGNITUDE
This property is used by constant, spring, friction and viscous effect types. This will be the cap on the maximum force that will be generated

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_FREQUENCY

public static final int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_FREQUENCY
Reserved for use by future effect types and callback effects

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_DURATION

public static final int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_DURATION
Used by all effects started with a call to hlTriggerEffect. The effect will be automatically be terminated when the specified duration has elapsed

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_POSITION

public static final int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_POSITION
This property is used by spring effect. The parameter passed will be the anchor of the spring

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_DIRECTION

public static final int HL_EFFECT_PROPERTY_DIRECTION
This property is used by constant effect. The parameter passed will represent the direction of the constant force vector

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_COMPUTE_FORCE

public static final int HL_EFFECT_COMPUTE_FORCE
Gets the computed force for the effect

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_START

public static final int HL_EFFECT_START
Indicates the start of an effect definition or excution

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_EFFECT_STOP

public static final int HL_EFFECT_STOP
Indicates the end of a effect excution or definition

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_VERSION

public static final int HL_VERSION
Gets the version of the haptic library that this API is binding to

See Also:
Constant Field Values

HL_VENDOR

public static final int HL_VENDOR
Gets the name of the company responsible for the renderer library that this API is binding to

See Also:

HLAPI

public HLAPI()
Method Detail

hlBeginFrame

public static void hlBeginFrame()
                         throws HLException
Begins a haptic frame, starts render to send data to haptic device

Throws:
HLException - - if nested within another hlBeginFrame statement

hlContextDevice

public static void hlContextDevice(int hHD)
                            throws HLException
Sets the haptic device for the current rendering context

Parameters:
hHD - the device ID that you wish set
Throws:
HLException - If nested within a hlBeginFrame or if no haptic rendering context is active

hlCreateContext

public static int hlCreateContext(int hHD)
Creates a new haptic rendering context for the given haptic device

Parameters:
hHD - the device ID that you wish to create a context for
Returns:
and integer to represent or indentify the HHLRC that has been created

hlDeleteContext

public static void hlDeleteContext(int hHLRC)
Deletes a haptic device rendering context

Parameters:
hHLRC - the rendering context ID that you wish to delete

hlEndFrame

public static void hlEndFrame()
                       throws HLException
Ends a haptic frame, the block now send the code to the haptic device

Throws:
HLException - If the hlBeginFrame is not set, or if there is no renderer context current

hlGetCurrentContext

public static int hlGetCurrentContext()
Returns the ID for the current haptic device rendering context

Returns:
Integer that is used to identify/refer to the context

hlGetCurrentDevice

public static int hlGetCurrentDevice()
Returns the current device in use for the present context

Returns:
Integer that is used to identify/refer to the device

hlMakeCurrent

public static void hlMakeCurrent(int hHLRC)
Makes a current context current, a current context is used to send force to its device

Parameters:
hHLRC - the context ID that you wish to make current

                                int shape)
                         throws HLException

Throws:

                       throws HLException

                               int pname,
                               float param)
                        throws HLException

Parameters:
face - The face(s) to apply the property to, see:
  • HL_FRONT
  • HL_BACK
  • HL_FRONT_AND_BACK
pname - The property to apply to the material of the give face(s), see:
  • HL_STIFFNESS
  • HL_DAMPING
  • HL_STATIC_FRICTION
  • HL_DYNAMIC_FRICTION
param - The Value to set the property to for the give face(s)
Throws:
HLException - If the face or property is unknown, or if there is no haptic renderer context active. The value to set must be between 0 and 1

hlStartEffect

public static void hlStartEffect(int type,
                                 int effect)
                          throws HLException
Starts an effect which will continue to run until it is terminated by hlStopEffect

Parameters:
type - The type of effect to start, see:
  • HL_EFFECT_CONSTANT
  • HL_EFFECT_SPRING
  • HL_EFFECT_VISCOUS
  • HL_EFFECT_FRICTION
  • HL_EFFECT_CALLBACK
effect - The unique identifier of the effect to start
Throws:
HLException - If type is not known, or if not within a hlBeginFrame/hlEndFrame or if inside hlBeginShape/hlEndShape

hlStopEffect

public static void hlStopEffect(int effect)
                         throws HLException
Stops an effect which has been started by hlStartEffect

Parameters:
effect - The unique identifier of the effect to stop
Throws:
HLException - If type is not known, or if not within a hlBeginFrame/hlEndFrame or if inside hlBeginShape/hlEndShape

                            throws HLException

  • HL_EFFECT_SPRING
  • HL_EFFECT_VISCOUS
  • HL_EFFECT_FRICTION
  • HL_EFFECT_CALLBACK

HLException - If the type is an unknown type, or if not within a hlBeginFrame/hlEndFrame or if inside hlBeginShape/hlEndShape

hlOrtho

public static void hlOrtho(double left,
                           double right,
                           double bottom,
                           double top,
                           double zNear,
                           double zFar)
                    throws HLException
Sets up the haptic view volume which determines how determines the mapping between workspace to graphical view volume

Parameters:
left - A double value that specifies the left boundaries
right - A double value that specifies the right boundaries
bottom - A double value that specifies the bottom boundaries
top - A double value that specifies the top boundaries
zNear - A double value that specifies the front boundaries
zFar - A double value that specifies the back boundaries
Throws:
HLException - If no haptic renderer context is active

hlPushMatrix

public static void hlPushMatrix()
                         throws HLException
Pushes a new matrix onto the top of the current stack

Throws:
HLException - If no haptic renderer context is active or if the matrix stack already full

hlPopMatrix

public static void hlPopMatrix()
                        throws HLException
Removes the top matrix from the top of the current stack

Throws:
HLException - If no haptic renderer context is active or if the matrix stack is only one deep

hlRotated

public static void hlRotated(double angle,
                             double x,
                             double y,
                             double z)
                      throws HLException
Multiplies the current matrix on top of the current stack by the 4x4 rotation matrix

Parameters:
angle - A double value specifing the degrees to rotate
x - A double value specifies to rotate on x axis
y - A double value specifies to rotate on y axis
z - A double value specifies to rotate on the z axis
Throws:
HLException - If there is no haptic renderer context is active

hlRotatef

public static void hlRotatef(float angle,
                             float x,
                             float y,
                             float z)
                      throws HLException
Multiplies the current matrix on top of the current stack by the 4x4 rotation matrix

Parameters:
angle - A float value specifing the degrees to rotate
x - A float value specifies to rotate on x axis
y - A float value specifies to rotate on y axis
z - A float value specifies to rotate on the z axis
Throws:
HLException - If there is no haptic renderer context is active

hlScaled

public static void hlScaled(double x,
                            double y,
                            double z)
                     throws HLException
Multiplies the current matrix on top of the current stack by the 4x4 scale matrix

Parameters:
x - A double value to specifie scale factor for the x axis
y - A double value to specifie scale factor for the y axis
z - A double value to specifie scale factor for the z axis
Throws:
HLException - If there is no haptic renderer context is active

hlScalef

public static void hlScalef(float x,
                            float y,
                            float z)
                     throws HLException
Multiplies the current matrix on top of the current stack by the 4x4 scale matrix

Parameters:

y - A float value to specifie scale factor for the y axis
z - A float value to specifie scale factor for the z axis
Throws:
HLException - If there is no haptic renderer context is active

hlTranslated

public static void hlTranslated(double x,
                                double y,
                                double z)
                         throws HLException
Multiplies the current matrix on top of the current stack by the 4x4 translation matrix

Parameters:
x - A double value to specifie the translation vector for the x axis
y - A double value to specifie the translation vector for the y axis
z - A double value to specifie the translation vector for the z axis
Throws:
HLException - If no haptic renderer context is active

hlTranslatef

public static void hlTranslatef(float x,
                                float y,
                                float z)
                         throws HLException
Multiplies the current matrix on top of the current stack by the 4x4 translation matrix

Parameters:
x - A flaot value to specifie the translation vector for the x axis
y - A float value to specifie the translation vector for the y axis
z - A float value to specifie the translation vector for the z axis
Throws:
HLException - If no haptic renderer context is active

hlWorkspace

public static void hlWorkspace(double left,
                               double bottom,
                               double back,
                               double right,
                               double top,
                               double front)
                        throws HLException
Defines the extents of the workspace of the haptic device that will be used for mapping between graphics and physical coordinates

Parameters:
left - A double value for the left boundaries of the haptic device workspace
bottom - A double value for the bottom boundaries of the haptic device workspace
back - A double value for the back boundaries of the haptic device workspace
right - A double value for the right boundaries of the haptic device workspace
top - A double value for the top boundaries of the haptic device workspace
front - A double value for the front boundaries of the haptic device workspace
Throws:
HLException - If no haptic renderer context is active

hlUpdateCalibration

public static void hlUpdateCalibration()
                                throws HLException
Causes the haptic device to re calibrate

Throws:
HLException - if no haptic renderer context is available

hlCallback

public static void hlCallback(int type,
                              HLCallback obj,
                              java.lang.Object[] userdata)
                       throws HLException
Sets a user callback function

Parameters:
type - The type of callback to set, see:
  • HL_SHAPE_INTERSECT_LS
  • HL_SHAPE_CLOSEST_FEATURE
obj - The Object to callback to, must implement HLCallback
userdata - An array of user data to pass back to the user Callback function on call
Throws:
HLException - if the type is unknown, or no haptic renderer context is active

hlAddEventCallback

public static void hlAddEventCallback(int shape,
                                      int thread,
                                      HLEventCallback obj,
                                      java.lang.Object[] userdata)
                               throws HLException
Adds a user event callback function to a shape

Parameters:
shape - The shape to callback event for
thread - The thread to callback in for events, see:
  • HL_COLLISION_THREAD
  • HL_CLIENT_THREAD
obj - The Object to listen for events, must implement HLEventCallback
userdata - An array of user data to pass back to the user Event function on call throws HLException If event thread is not known, or if no haptic renderer context is active
Throws:
HLException

hlRemoveEventCallback

public static void hlRemoveEventCallback(int shape,
                                         int thread,
                                         HLEventCallback obj)
Removes an existing user defined event handler function from the list of callback functions

Parameters:
shape - The ID for the shape to remove the event callback from
thread - The thread to the event callback belongs to, see:
  • HL_COLLISION_THREAD
  • HL_CLIENT_THREAD
obj - The listener to remove from the event callback for the given shape and thread

hlCheckEvents

public static void hlCheckEvents()
                          throws HLException
Calls callback function for all events that are subscribed to and that have occured since the last call to hlCheckEvents

Throws:
HLException - If there is no haptic renderer context active

hlEventd

public static void hlEventd(int pname,
                            double param)
                     throws HLException
Set parameters that influence how and when event callbacks occure

Parameters:
pname - The name of the event parameter to set, see:
  • HL_EVENT_MOTION_LINEAR_TOLERANCE
  • HL_EVENT_MOTION_ANGULAR_TOLERANCE
param - The doubel value to set the event parameter to
Throws:
HLException - If pname is unknown or param is out of range, or if there is no haptic renderer context active
